tournament.name: Manila Duel Commander August 2012 (Quezon City, Philippines)

decks.notes: This deck revolves around using control elements to disrupt opponents while building up a board presence with Geist of Saint Traft. The key strategy involves using counterspells, removal spells, and bounce effects to control the game, protecting Geist and other key threats. The deck also includes creatures with disruptive abilities and powerful equipment to increase the pressure on opponents. The mana base is optimized for consistency and includes utility lands to support the control game plan. Overall, the deck aims to slow down opponents, protect its own threats, and eventually win the game through incremental advantage and strategic plays.

The main idea of this deck is to utilize Edric, Spymaster of Trest's ability to draw cards whenever a creature deals combat damage to an opponent. By playing aggressively and consistently attacking with creatures, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with card advantage, constant pressure, and tempo. The deck likely includes evasive creatures, mana dorks, and disruptive spells to support this strategy. The key is to maintain a steady stream of attackers to draw cards and outvalue the opponent, while also having the ability to protect Edric and withstand any opposing threats. This deck focuses on taking advantage of Edric's ability to gain incremental advantage and win the game through card advantage and aggression.

The main focus of this Esper Control deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's game plan while simultaneously setting up for powerful late-game plays. With a wide array of counterspells, removal spells, and hand disruption cards, the deck aims to control the board and prevent the opponent from executing their strategy effectively. The deck also includes powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Liliana of the Veil, as well as strong finishers like Elspeth, Knight-Errant and Gideon Jura. By efficiently handling threats and drawing cards through spells like Fact or Fiction and Ancestral Vision, the deck seeks to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent until it can secure a commanding position and close out the game.

This deck focuses on utilizing Scion of the Ur-Dragon as the commander to quickly assemble a powerful board presence and overwhelm opponents with aggressive strategies. The deck includes a variety of removal spells, tutors, and powerful creatures to control the game and apply pressure early on. With a mix of card advantage, mana acceleration, and disruptive elements, the goal is to outpace opponents and secure victory through a combination of efficient threats and disruptive spells. The mana base is carefully crafted to support the deck's color requirements and provide consistent access to the necessary resources to execute its game plan effectively.

The main focus of this deck is to efficiently tutor and play powerful legendary creatures and equipment to dominate the battlefield. By utilizing Captain Sisay's ability to search for legendary cards, the deck aims to control the board and disrupt opponents while putting pressure with creatures like Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite and Sigarda, Host of Herons. The deck is built around maximizing the effectiveness of each card drawn, with an emphasis on utility and consistency. It also includes a variety of removal and protection spells to ensure the commander and other key creatures can stay on the board and continue to threaten the opponent's life total.

The primary focus of this deck is to utilize the commander, Iname, Death Aspect, as a key component of a combo strategy. The deck includes various tutors, card draw spells, and disruption to help assemble the combo pieces efficiently. The combo likely involves graveyard manipulation and reanimation effects, as well as powerful finishers like Living Death, Patriarch's Bidding, and Army of the Damned. The deck also includes a variety of efficient removal spells and defense mechanisms to protect the combo pieces and disrupt opponents. Additionally, the mana base is heavily focused on utilizing Swamps and includes utility lands like Bojuka Bog and Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth to support the deck's strategy.

The main focus of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's hand and board state while ramping up and generating value through sacrificing creatures and making the opponent discard cards. By using cards like Hymn to Tourach, Thoughtseize, and Duress, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and strip their hand of key cards. Nath of the Gilt-Leaf's ability to generate 1/1 Elf tokens whenever an opponent discards a card plays a key role in building a board presence. The deck also includes a variety of sacrifice effects like Grave Pact and Sadistic Hypnotist to further take advantage of the discarded cards and generate value. Ultimately, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggro pressure and resource denial.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of removal spells, hand disruption, and board wipes to maintain dominance over your opponent. The goal is to use Skithiryx, the Blight Dragon as a win condition, combining it with equipment and pump spells to quickly defeat the opponent. The deck also includes a range of powerful tutors to search for key cards and ramp to accelerate your game plan. With a strong mana base and a selection of powerful spells, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy, control the board, and ultimately achieve victory through a combination of strategic plays and efficient removal.
